page.title: 13More about our Visit
page.content: During the two{World Wars}the house was commissioned by the army and used as a headquarters for offices. After the last war the house was bought by the{Seaman's Orphanage.}Then the Welfare Department bought the house and it was used for many years as a home for ladies who have spent a long time in{hospital.}For the last seven years the house has been used for training people of all ages to be able to live in the community after having an illness. The house has been altered only on the inside, as it had to be adapted for the various uses it has been put to. We believe that {Moorhill}got it's name from the{Town {Moor}and{Tunstall Hills}which it stands between. At the bottom of the garden where the greenhouse stood, we found a{wine bottle.
